title: is booting from O2micro SD SCSI card slot possible?

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
hello everyone,  

I would like to boot XP from the SD card slot in my laptop.  

I have had success booting USBoot XP from SD card through a USB card reader but no success directly from the slot.  

I think I need to load the card slot drivers but I dont know how, where, or when.  

any helpful information on the subject is good to me!  

please forgive me if I have mis posted, I know this is not booting from USB but I did not see where else I should ask in boot-land and I know boot-land is the right place!  

thanks

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
It's a recurring topic.  

The "bootable" SD card slot is something that not many hardwares sport, so the number of people attempting to boot from it is very, very small.  

The usual plot is ![:unsure:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/unsure.png):  
OP.:Hey, can we boot from SD?  
HM.:Maybe, let's try.  
OP.: I tried this but it doesn't work, what else can I try?  
HM.: Try this other thing...  
OP: ....vanished in the mist of the net ....![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)  
(where OP is Original Poster and HM is Helping Member)  

In other words, there are not AFAIK known working methods, and the theories possibly usable have not been tested enough and successfully.  

If you are game, start from here:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9036](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9036 "External link")  

read the thread and given links in it, then post some info on your actual hardware, and let's start working...![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png)  

![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png)  
Wonko
